p: National public goods are funded mostly by governments, and so is the expectation from developing country negotiators, as the Paris Agreement Article 9.3 emphasizes the importance of public finance. Because of developing countries’ pressure, the GEF has broadened its understanding of global benefit, and funded a number of adaptation projects. In recent times, both the GCF and the GEF are increasing funding for regional and global projects on both adaptation and mitigation, including resilience-building in marine environments.
